Kevin Wang

Hey there, thanks for stopping by! I’m Kevin Wang and I am a PhD pre-candidate in computer science in the Systopia Lab at the University of British Columbia. I am fortunate enough to be coadvised by Aastha Mehta and Nyugen Phong Hoang. I am broadly interested in systems and network security, particularly in providing citizens worldwide with ways to secure their right to access internet and technology.

Before arriving at UBC, I graduated from the University of Michigan with both a master’s and bachelor’s in Computer Science and Engineering. I had the pleasure of working with with Roya Ensafi and Ram Sundara Raman on censorship measurement and with Carol Flannagan on bias in AI annotation in transportation research. I was a Fulbright scholar to Poland in 2023-24, where I taught English and computer science at the University of Łomża, a small regional university in rural Poland.

I took musicer as my online tag because I started university as a clarinet performance major (and also because there are way too many Kevin Wangs already!). If you see musicer mentioned elsewhere in computer science, it’s probably me :)

Feel free to reach out at musicer <at> cs <dot> ubc <dot> ca!

Portfolio site for Kevin Wang, computer security PhD pre-candidate at UBC.
